meanings.definition: To choose not to do or have something
meanings.sent1: I will abstain from eating sweets to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: She decided to abstain from watching TV to focus on her studies.
meanings.sent3: John had to abstain from playing video games until he finished his homework.
meanings.sent4: The doctor advised him to abstain from smoking to improve his health.
meanings.sent5: Abstaining from gossiping can lead to more positive relationships.

meanings.sent1: I will abstain from voting in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: Some people choose to abstain from voting due to lack of interest.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to abstain from choosing a favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: She felt it was best to abstain from voting on the controversial issue.
meanings.sent5: Abstaining from voting is also a way to express dissatisfaction with the options.

meanings.definition: To refrain from indulging in something
meanings.sent1: I need to abstain from eating too much chocolate.
meanings.sent2: He decided to abstain from alcohol for a month.
meanings.sent3: The children had to abstain from eating candy until after dinner.
meanings.sent4: She chose to abstain from buying new clothes to save money.
meanings.sent5: Abstaining from social media can help improve productivity.
